name: Strontium Dog: The Killing
description:
Mutant bounty hunter Johnny Alpha makes the leap from the pages of 2000 AD to the Spectrum in The Killing, an action game based on a storyline from the comic.

The Killing is an annual competition, where the galaxy's most notorious criminals and murderers meet to fight to the death. Johnny Alpha joins the contest with two goals: to kill all the criminals (and collect the bounty on their heads) and to get to the evil despots organizing the bloodsport.

Seen from above, the player controls Johnny on his way through a maze of more than 200 rooms. 93 other contestants are present in the maze, and all must be vanquished to win. Most can simply be shot with Johnny's blaster. Some encounters based on situations from the comic require a different approach though: ambushes await at the medical stations, and Johnny must fire an electro flare into a station to knock out the occupants. Special enemies include the evil android Steelkreeg and cunning killer Barnak Spraks, who enjoys playing dead, waiting for his moment to strike.

The player must next select their choice of controller. The text here scrolls through different colours to the accompaniment of an annoying electronic sound akin to a burglar alarm
After a brief animation the games begin. Note the reference to Borzak the big baddie
The game starts in a maze. Any contact with a blue wall means death (it's electro-charged or something). Doors open automatically though and there doesn't seem to be any need for keys
I think that behind these barriers are aliens that should be shot
The bad guys behind the barriers are hard to shoot. They move fast and bounce bombs around the room making staying in one place a dangerous thing to do
Some rooms like this have baddies behind every door
Game over. After a while, if nothing happens, the background begins to strobe and later still the player is returned to the main menu
